comments:
Created an attachment (id=77550)
report design

Description:
Change the data type in chart cannot effect[0602]

Step:
1. New a sample datasource and dataset select * from offiecs
2. New a table and binding the dataset.
3. Add a chart in table detail row.
4. Change the column of OFFICECODE as int type.
5. Drop OFFICECODE to Y and CITY to X.
6. Preview

Actual result:
Pop up an error.

Chart NewChart: 
- Unable to use a text data to render a numerical/datetime axis. 
exception.text.data.numerical.datetime.axis ( 7 time(s) )

The attached report can be previewed in chart builder, bur fails in preview page. It's probable that engine has set wrong queries in chart.

Seems be DTE's bug. Engine has created a query with setting the "offcecode" columnBinding's value type be integer. But in the resultSet, DTE still use String type. That will confuse Chart.

Re-assign to DTE for further research.
When we copy the parent query binding into sub query, we should also set the data type of parent column binding. Fix it now!
